net.sf.mpxj.common

Class LocalDateTimeHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mpxj.common.LocalDateTimeHelper

  • public final class LocalDateTimeHelper
extends Object
    Common code for working with LocalDateTime instances.

    • Field Detail

      • START_DATE_NA

        public static final LocalDateTime START_DATE_NA
        Date representing NA at the start of a date range: January 01 00:00:00 1984.

      • END_DATE_NA

        public static final LocalDateTime END_DATE_NA
        Date representing NA at the end of a date range: Friday December 31 23:59:00 2049. That's actually the value used by older versions of MS Project. The most recent version of MS Project uses Friday December 31 23:59:06 2049 (note the six extra seconds). The problem with using this value to represent NA at the end of a date range is it isn't interpreted correctly by older versions of MS Project. The compromise here is that we'll use the value recognised by older versions of MS Project, which will work as expected and display NA as the end date. For the current version of MS Project this will display a the end date as 2049, rather than NA, but this should still be interpreted correctly. TODO: consider making this behaviour configurable.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getDayStartDate

        public static LocalDateTime getDayStartDate(LocalDateTime date)
        Returns a new Date instance whose value represents the start of the day (i.e. the time of day is 00:00:00.000)
        Parameters:
        date - date to convert
        Returns:
        day start date

      • compare

        public static int compare(LocalDateTime startDate,
                          LocalDateTime endDate,
                          LocalDateTime targetDate)
        This method compares a target date with a date range. The method will return 0 if the date is within the range, less than zero if the date is before the range starts, and greater than zero if the date is after the range ends.
        Parameters:
        startDate - range start date
        endDate - range end date
        targetDate - target date in milliseconds
        Returns:
        comparison result

      • compare

        public static int compare(LocalDateTime d1,
                          LocalDateTime d2)
        Compare two dates, handling null values. TODO: correct the comparison order to align with Date.compareTo
        Parameters:
        d1 - Date instance
        d2 - Date instance
        Returns:
        int comparison result

      • min

        public static LocalDateTime min(LocalDateTime d1,
                                LocalDateTime d2)
        Returns the earlier of two dates, handling null values. A non-null Date is always considered to be earlier than a null Date.
        Parameters:
        d1 - Date instance
        d2 - Date instance
        Returns:
        Date earliest date

      • max

        public static LocalDateTime max(LocalDateTime d1,
                                LocalDateTime d2)
        Returns the later of two dates, handling null values. A non-null Date is always considered to be later than a null Date.
        Parameters:
        d1 - Date instance
        d2 - Date instance
        Returns:
        Date latest date

      • parseBest

        public static LocalDateTime parseBest(DateTimeFormatter format,
                                      String value)
        Use the parseBest method of the formatter to retrieve a LOcaldateTimeinstance handling the case where the formatter returns a LOcalDate instance.
        Parameters:
        format - DateTimeFormatter instance
        value - value to parse
        Returns:
        LocalDateTime instance

      • getVariance

        public static Duration getVariance(ProjectCalendar calendar,
                                   LocalDateTime date1,
                                   LocalDateTime date2,
                                   TimeUnit format)
        This utility method calculates the difference in working time between two dates, given the context of a calendar.
        Parameters:
        calendar - calendar
        date1 - first date
        date2 - second date
        format - required format for the resulting duration
        Returns:
        difference in working time between the two dates
